bill_title: to grant certain jurisdiction over the Federal Prison Camp to the United States.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to cede certain jurisdiction over the Federal Prison Camp to the United States. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Pursuant to § 1-1-1, the people of this State, as expressed by their Legislature, hereby cede, to the United States, jurisdiction over those lands in Yankton County, South Dakota, known as the Federal Prison Camp. This cession of jurisdiction shall continue only so long as the United States owns and occupies such lands for such purposes. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to cede certain jurisdiction over the Federal Prison Camp to the United States. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Pursuant to § 1-1-1, the people of this State, as expressed by their Legislature, hereby cede, to the United States, concurrent jurisdiction over those lands in Yankton County, South Dakota, known as the Federal Prison Camp. This cession of concurrent jurisdiction shall continue only so long as the United States owns and occupies such lands for such purposes. BILL HISTORY 1/16/98 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 54 1/21/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/21/98 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 141

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to grant certain jurisdiction over the Federal Prison Camp to the United States. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Pursuant to § 1-1-1, the people of this State, as expressed by their Legislature, hereby grants, to the United States, concurrent jurisdiction over those lands in Yankton County, South Dakota, known as the Federal Prison Camp. This grant of concurrent jurisdiction shall continue only so long as the United States owns and occupies such lands for such purposes and does not constitute a waiver of any state or local jurisdiction that the state or any local government may choose to exercise concurrently with federal jurisdiction. BILL HISTORY 1/16/98 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 54 1/21/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/21/98 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 141 1/23/98 House of Representatives Deferred to another day. H.J. 203 1/27/98 House of Representatives Deferred to another day. H.J. 258 2/2/98 Motion to Amend, Passed. H.J. 339 2/2/98 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 68, NAYS 0. H.J. 339 2/2/98 House of Representatives Title Amended. H.J. 340
